meanings.definition: Zemindars: Landowners in India who collected taxes
meanings.sent1: The zemindars managed the tax collection in their villages.
meanings.sent2: During the British rule, zemindars played a crucial role in revenue collection.
meanings.sent3: The zemindars decided to have a tax collection race to see who could gather the most coins.
meanings.sent4: The zemindars were like diligent bees, buzzing around to gather the sweet nectar of taxes.
meanings.sent5: The image of the zemindars counting their tax earnings is etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: Zemindars: The system of land revenue collection in India
meanings.sent1: The zemindars' system of tax collection was efficient and organized.
meanings.sent2: Under the zemindars' administration, the revenue collection process improved.
meanings.sent3: The zemindars' way of collecting taxes was so smooth, it felt like a dance.
meanings.sent4: The zemindars' revenue collection system was a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The zemindars' method of revenue collection was like a symphony, each note perfectly in place.

meanings.definition: Zemindars: A group of wealthy landowners in colonial India
meanings.sent1: The zemindars in colonial India lived in grand estates.
meanings.sent2: The British officials often consulted the zemindars on matters of land ownership.
meanings.sent3: The zemindars' parties were the talk of the town, with lavish feasts and entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The zemindars were like kings of their own little kingdoms.
meanings.sent5: The zemindars' wealth shone like a beacon in the colonial landscape.
